elements.label: Side Objective: Aid Refugees
elements.description: Another band of desperates is caught between death at German hands or at Russian hands. It would take some work to bring them to safety - but they would be indebted to me afterwards. [A chance to obtain new Allies.]

elements.label: Church of St Marzanna the White
elements.description: On a hill above the city where the wind blows keen and fierce, a decaying wooden church stands in a bleak grove of leafless oak trees. Once, the Exile came here to receive a gift, or to take one. Now the White Saint waits there, and she has a gift for me.

elements.label: Pawiak Prison
elements.description: This prison has laid under the hand of the tsar, then the Second Republic, and now finally the Gestapo have run of the place. I am sure those imprisoned here would be grateful for freedom - and I am also sure that the Germans in charge of the place have accumulated curious treasures from the imprisoned.

elements.label: Observatory Bastion
elements.description: The actual observatory lies a ruin nearby, thanks to RAF bombing. But the adjacent fortress itself remains a devilishly defensible nest of Wehrmacht fighters, entrenched and armed to the teeth.

elements.label: Rafeleinz Abbey
elements.description: Once a place of splendour; now a place of grief. The abbey was established by a German-French branch of the Raveline family in the 11th century, proclaiming devotion to 'the Sun and the wolves that hound his Enemies.' The Intercalate, of course, changed the abbey and its guardians both, but both still remain, however darkly altered.

elements.label: Prague Orloj
elements.description: The clock of the Old Town Hall is mired in stories. Its architect, they say, threw himself into the clock's gears to curse any who would meddle with his handiwork; another legend says he was blinded after the tower's completion, so that no other city could have a clock so intricate. But a favorite story among Know relates that the clock was built at the request of Janus, and that his clocktower would rise also in the City Unbuilt to toll the fall and dissolution of the Hours.

elements.label: Milit√§rhistorisches Institut
elements.description: In 1920s, German authorities refurbished this place with mementoes and cautionary relics of the Third Worm War. Architectural techniques adapted from the Worm Museum have allowed the Insitute to function safely in a semi-public manner, but now war has laid low its walls. Some of the exposed exhibits are becoming congregating points for troublesome entities.

elements.label: Houska Castle
elements.description: The Germans kept notable prisoners here: resistance fighters, scholars, dissidents. Later, they also began to conduct experiments beneath the castle. Many of those experiments have now escaped into the surrounding countryside - but some of them have taken a liking to the old castle stones, and made a nest therein.

elements.label: Main Objective: Berlin East
elements.description: The reversal of the Eastern Front culminates here - here, the last vestiges of the Wehrmacht struggle vainly as wave after red wave of Soviet manpower crashes on their defences. But I am coming, and I am a force all on my own. They will see.

elements.label: COMPLETE: Berlin East
elements.description: In the strets lie the soldiers of hooked cross and of red bear: dead and slain in the east. The flies sing.

elements.label: Main Objective: Central Berlin
elements.description: There: huddled in lightless rooms, shivering in shadow of the ruin and stinking of fear. The unarmed. The helpless. Prey.

elements.label: COMPLETE: Central Berlin
elements.description: Wolves in the henhouse at the heart of Berlin. Women, children, the sick and the old - their blood is all the same shining black in the moonlight.

elements.label: Main Objective: Berlin North
elements.description: The German soldiers who fled the Russians in the east find themselves pressed up against the skin of the world, and with each turn of the Corrivality, more of it thins away. What will come through the open door when it finally gives way? I don't care, in truth - whatever it is, I will send back there screaming.

elements.label: COMPLETE: Berlin North
elements.description: In the north of Berlin, I have spilled blood on both sides of the dream. The Corrivality drinks of the carnage, and greedily.

elements.label: Main Objective: Seize
elements.description: The enemy garrison here is furnished with a hefty depot of supplies. If we could break past their defences, we could take those supplies for ourselves. [Completing this will reward you with Provisions and other useful items.]

elements.label: Main Objective: Breakout
elements.description: The Germans have erected another one of their ghettos in this city - I will spring its prisoners free, and give them the means to take whatever vengeance they desire. [Completing this will reward you with Allies.]

elements.label: Main Objective: Raze
elements.description: I want this city to burn. [Completing this Objective will make all Neutral units at the Current Warzone hostile, but completing it will grant you otherworldly assistance from the Wolf-Divided.]

elements.label: Main Objective: Eliminate
elements.description: A red-handed high officer of the German Army moves within the city - I will have his death.

elements.label: Main Objective: Rout
elements.description: Our aim is simple: utter annihilation of the enemy. Kill them all.

elements.label: Side Objective: A Forgotten Light?
elements.description: Beneath the mire of old despair and familiar pains, something calls out to me in the midst of the dream - whimpering and faint, but present all the same. I am drawn to it, closer and closer, like a moth to the candle, or a wolf to meat.

slots.label: Something More?
slots.description: A knot of power? A confluence? A sign of the earth, or the sky?

elements.label: Main Objective: Overcome Fear
elements.description: This is the shadow I carry of the Exile - the one who broke me, molded me - and so long as I carry that shadow in my heart, I will cower at the sight of my hated enemy, and my vengeance will be beyond me. So, this shadow must die.
